publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3207 Christine Grahame: Peebles Sheriff Court—That the Parliament notes with concern the threat of the permanent closure of Peebles Sheriff Court; further notes that the Minister for Justice is currently considering a report into the expenditure required to make the courthouse fully operational and intends to make his conclusion public soon; further notes that the retention of the sheriff court at Peebles is supported by, inter alia, the Sheriff Principal of Lothian and Borders, the two sheriffs who sit there, the Society of Solicitors in the Shires of Selkirk and Peebles and the Faculty of Solicitors in Roxburghshire, and urges the Scottish Executive, in implementing its commitment to access to justice for all, to keep a sheriff court at Peebles, either refurbished or new build.
S1M-3207 Peebles Sheriff Court (lodged on 12 June 2002) Michael Matheson*

S1M-3207 Christine Grahame: Peebles Sheriff Court-That the Parliament notes with concern the threat of the permanent closure of Peebles Sheriff Court; further notes that the Minister for Justice is currently considering a report into the expenditure required to make the courthouse fully operational and intends to make his conclusion public soon; further notes that the retention of the sheriff court at Peebles is supported by, inter alia, the Sheriff Principal of Lothian and Borders, the two sheriffs who sit there, the Society of Solicitors in the Shires of Selkirk and Peebles and the Faculty of Solicitors in Roxburghshire, and urges the Scottish Executive, in implementing its commitment to access to justice for all, to keep a sheriff court at Peebles, either refurbished or new build. Supported by: Michael Matheson
S1M-3207 Peebles Sheriff Court (lodged on 12 June 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3207 Peebles Sheriff Court (lodged on 12 June 2002) Mr Murray Tosh*

S1M-3207# Christine Grahame: Peebles Sheriff Court—That the Parliament notes with concern the threat of the permanent closure of Peebles Sheriff Court; further notes that the Minister for Justice is currently considering a report into the expenditure required to make the courthouse fully operational and intends to make his conclusion public soon; further notes that the retention of the sheriff court at Peebles is supported by, inter alia, the Sheriff Principal of Lothian and Borders, the two sheriffs who sit there, the Society of Solicitors in the Shires of Selkirk and Peebles and the Faculty of Solicitors in Roxburghshire, and *considers that* the Scottish Executive, in implementing its commitment to access to justice for all, *should* keep a sheriff court at Peebles, either refurbished or new build. Supported by: Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Ms Sandra White*, Brian Adam*, Fiona Hyslop*
